item.title: 美国呼吁数据中心在风暴来临前准备备用电源
item.description: 美国政府要求全国电网运营商从包括数据中心在内的设施中调配备用电力，以应对这场创纪录的冬季风暴可能引发的全国性停电。【原文：The US government asked the nation’s grid operators to make backup power available from facilities including data centers as a record-breaking winter storm threatens blackouts across the country.】

item.title: 北海国家将承诺共同建设并保护风电场
item.description: 包括英国、德国和荷兰在内的国家将承诺在北海共同开发100吉瓦的海上风电产能，并加强此类基础设施的安全保障，以应对日益加剧的破坏威胁。【原文：Countries including the UK, Germany and the Netherlands will pledge to jointly develop 100 gigawatts of offshore wind capacity in the North Sea and step up security of such infrastructure amid growing threats of sabotage.】

item.title: 美国将取消拜登时期近300亿美元能源贷款
item.description: 特朗普政府表示，在审查了前总统乔·拜登任内批准的交易后，将取消能源部绿色银行近300亿美元的融资。【原文：The Trump administration said it’s canceling almost $30 billion of financing from the Energy Department’s green bank after reviewing transactions approved under former President Joe Biden.】

item.title: 高温与特大干旱如何为智利毁灭性野火埋下祸根
item.description:
自2017年创纪录的大火以来，火灾季节变得更长且威胁更大。【原文：

Fire seasons have become longer and more threatening since record-breaking blazes in 2017. 

】

item.title: 纽约市严阵以待，暴风雪将带来近一英尺积雪
item.description: 纽约市本周末将遭遇近一英尺的暴雪袭击，这对新任市长佐兰·曼达尼而言是一场考验。随着大规模天气系统登陆该地区，停电、航班延误和公共交通系统问题正威胁着这座城市。【原文：New York City is poised to get pummeled with nearly a foot of snow this weekend, a test for new Mayor Zohran Mamdani, as a massive weather system lands on the region threatening power outages, airline delays and transit system problems.】

item.title: 印度在电状态曲线上的发展阶段已超越中国当年所处的位置
item.description: 今日《绿色日报》聚焦印度快速推进的电气化进程，以及正向美国袭来的强劲冬季风暴。【原文：Today’s Green Daily newsletter covers India’s rapid electrification and the major winter storm heading for the US】

item.title: 得州电网面临本季最强风暴严峻考验
item.description: 一场强劲的冬季风暴将于周五席卷得克萨斯州，这将是该州电力系统自2021年致命寒潮导致系统崩溃以来面临的最严峻考验之一。【原文：A powerful winter storm descending on Texas on Friday will be one of the toughest tests of the state’s electric grid since the system collapsed during a deadly 2021 freeze.】

item.title: 印度正以比中国更快的速度实现电气化，采用廉价绿色技术
item.description:
发展中国家正利用太阳能、风能和电池价格下跌的优势。【原文：

Developing countries are taking advantage of falling prices for solar, wind and batteries. 

】

item.title: 英国向南非提供10亿美元气候协议担保
item.description: 英国与非洲开发银行向南非提供了一项与气候相关的10亿美元债务担保，挽救了一项面临失效风险的4亿美元市政融资协议。【原文：The UK and the African Development Bank extended a climate-linked $1 billion debt guarantee to South Africa, saving a $400 million municipal funding deal that was in jeopardy if it had expired.】

item.title: 日本严阵以待，应对暴雪预警可能引发的混乱
item.description: 日本气象厅警告称，截至周日，日本部分地区将出现强降雪，日本海沿岸地区尤为严重。预计至周五上午6时，北陆地区24小时内降雪量将达100厘米（40英寸）。【原文：The Japan Meteorological Agency is warning of heavy snow in some parts of the country through Sunday, particularly on the Sea of Japan coast, with as much as 100 cm (40 inches) expected in the Hokuriku region in the 24 hours to 6 a.m. Friday.】

item.title: 塞拉俱乐部称美国养老金缺乏强有力的气候战略
item.description:
该研究显示，截至去年年底，仅有五家基金设立了气候投资目标。

【原文：

Only five funds had climate investment targets in place at the end of last year, according to the study.

】

item.title: 去年欧洲风能和太阳能发电量首次超越化石燃料
item.description:
据智库Ember数据显示，该地区三分之一的电力来自这两种绿色能源。

【原文：

A third of the power generated in the region came from the two green sources, according to the think tank Ember.

】

item.title: 得克萨斯州遭遇严寒，纽约周末降雪风险升高
item.description: 一场大规模冬季风暴将于周五起席卷美国广阔区域，先是让得克萨斯州陷入冰封，随后将沿东海岸猛烈北上。纽约市和波士顿地区预计到周日将出现强降雪。【原文：A massive winter storm will sweep across a huge swath of the US starting Friday, freezing Texas before roaring up the East Coast, where New York City and Boston are seeing a strong chance of heavy snow by Sunday.】

item.title: 卡塔尔称欧盟规则放宽为更多天然气交易敞开大门
item.description: 卡塔尔表示，欧盟推动减轻对外国的监管负担，为与该地区企业达成更多天然气协议打开了大门。【原文：Qatar said that the European Union’s push to ease some of its regulatory burden on foreign countries is opening the door to further gas deals with companies in the region.】

item.title: 中国在达沃斯演讲中呼吁全球气候合作
item.description: 副总理何立峰阐述了中国对建设绿色世界的愿景【原文：Vice Premier He Lifeng laid out China’s vision for a greener world】

item.title: 奥玛特支持开发干热岩的新一代地热初创企业
item.description:
该地热开发商联合领投了Sage Geosystems的新一轮融资，该公司正在内华达州建设其首个商业项目。 

【原文：

The geothermal developer co-led a new funding round for Sage Geosystems, which is building its first commercial project in Nevada. 

】

item.title: 克鲁格公园运营商考虑调整架构以开拓市场
item.description: 南非国家公园管理局董事会将审议是否调整公司架构，以实现直接从资本市场融资并保留更多收益的目标。该机构负责管理全球顶尖的自然保护区。【原文：The board of South African National Parks, which oversees some of the world’s premier nature reserves, will consider whether to change its corporate structure to allow it to borrow directly from capital markets and retain more of its earnings.】

item.title: 英国正商讨将西泽尔B核电站运行寿命延长至2055年
item.description: 英国正就延长塞兹韦尔B核电站寿命20年进行谈判，以支持日益依赖间歇性风能和太阳能发电的电网。【原文：The UK is negotiating to extend the life of the Sizewell B nuclear power station by 20 years as it seeks to support a grid increasingly reliant on intermittent wind and solar generation.】

item.title: 德国最脏的燃煤电厂重回盈利轨道
item.description: 德国部分污染最严重的发电厂已恢复盈利——并正扩大产能。【原文：Some of Germany’s most polluting power plants are back in profit — and ramping up output.】

item.title: 阿拉伯能源基金计划发行罕见熊猫债券，规模最高达14亿美元
item.description: 阿拉伯能源基金已获得中国监管机构批准，将通过发行人民币债券筹集最高100亿元人民币（合14亿美元），这为可能成为中东地区最大熊猫债券计划之一铺平了道路。【原文：The Arab Energy Fund has received regulatory approval in China to raise up to 10 billion yuan ($1.4 billion) through yuan‑denominated bonds, paving the way for what could be among the largest panda bond programs from the Middle East.】

item.title: 百货连锁企业将销售停滞归咎于印度空气污染
item.description: 据印度领先百货连锁企业Shoppers Stop Ltd.称，2025年末印度北部地区空气污染急剧恶化，对消费者需求造成冲击。该公司表示，空气污染问题是影响销售增长的诸多因素之一。【原文：A spike in air pollution across northern India in the final months of 2025 impacted consumer demand, according to Shoppers Stop Ltd., a leading department store chain which said the issue was among factors that weighed on sales growth.】

item.title: 绿色软件初创企业获12亿美元融资 加速欧盟太阳能业务扩张
item.description:
新一轮融资正值欧盟范围内住宅安装量持续下滑之际。 

【原文：

The new funding round comes as residential installations are declining across the bloc. 

】

item.title: 日本电力公司东京电力将重启自2011年福岛核事故以来首个核反应堆
item.description: 日本最大电力公司将重启2011年福岛核事故后首座核电站，这标志着全球重返核能的重大转折点。【原文：Japan’s largest utility will restart its first nuclear power plant since the 2011 Fukushima disaster, a watershed moment in the global return back to atomic energy.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚将撤销数十项许可证，此前该国发生致命洪灾
item.description: 印度尼西亚当局将森林滥用与去年12月苏门答腊岛造成千人死亡的洪水和山体滑坡事件联系起来后，决定撤销28家资源公司的许可证。【原文：Indonesia has decided to revoke permits held by 28 resource companies after authorities linked forest misuse to floods and landslides that killed more than a thousand people in Sumatra in December.】

item.title: 英国将投资150亿英镑以减少对燃气锅炉的依赖
item.description: 英国将在未来三年投入150亿英镑（约合200亿美元），帮助家庭降低能源账单并逐步淘汰燃气锅炉。【原文：The UK will spend £15 billion ($20 billion) over the next three years to help families cut their energy bills and switch away from gas boilers.】

item.title: 风能能否在特朗普的打压下生存？
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普曾极力阻挠风电产业发展。2025年重返白宫数小时内，特朗普便发布指令冻结风电项目新许可审批，并要求官员考虑终止现有租赁协议。【原文：US President Donald Trump has aggressively sought to thwart the wind power industry. Within hours of returning to the White House in 2025, Trump issued a directive that froze new permitting for wind energy and ordered officials to consider terminating existing leases.】

item.title: 科学家称数十亿人已进入"水资源破产"时代
item.description:
联合国最新报告指出，"压力"和"短缺"等词汇不足以准确描述当前全球多地面临的水资源危机。

【原文：

Stress and scarcity aren’t strong enough terms to capture the water crisis facing much of the world, according to a new UN report. 

】

item.title: 斯洛伐克总理菲科呼吁暂停欧洲旗舰碳市场
item.description: 斯洛伐克总理呼吁暂停欧盟减少碳排放的核心机制，称此举对于缓解工业压力、提升欧盟竞争力至关重要。【原文：Slovakia’s prime minister called for a suspension of the European Union’s central instrument to reduce carbon emissions, arguing the move is necessary to ease pressure on industry and boost the bloc’s competitiveness.】

item.title: 美国对廉价太阳能和风能"别无选择"，戈尔在达沃斯论坛如是说
item.description: 美国前副总统及其他人士在达沃斯论坛上就能源转型发表见解。【原文：The former US vice president and others weigh in on the energy transition at Davos.】

item.title: 阿尔·戈尔称特朗普阻挠海上风电建设是“疯狂之举”
item.description: 前美国副总统、Generation投资管理公司董事长阿尔·戈尔表示，特朗普总统阻挠海上风电场的举措违背常理。【原文：Al Gore, the chairman of Generation Investment Management and a former US vice president, said President Donald Trump’s efforts to block offshore wind farms defy logic.】
